comment.author: 41881839@N00
comment._content: Fred Merkle of what might be baseball's most infamous play, Merkle's Boner - which the poor lad was never able to live down, despite a long and successful career otherwise.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content: If that's really the World Series, it's probably Philadelphia catcher Ira Thomas.  (Their other catcher at the time, Jack Lapp, was a smaller man.)  But that's a pretty light crowd for a World Series game, wouldn't you say?
